introduction: Professor Yajin Wong from the University of Wisconsin Medicine discusses the potential of quantum computing in solving complex computational problems. He highlights the Google study problem, which involves finding random quantum circuits, and demonstrates how the permanent of a matrix can be calculated using quantum computing. Wong also discusses the challenges in comparing quantum computers to classical computers and the need for more statisticians to work in this field.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction
content: Professor Yajin Wong from the University of Wisconsin Medicine discusses the potential of quantum computing in solving complex computational problems.
He highlights the Google study problem, which involves finding random quantum circuits.
Wong demonstrates how the permanent of a matrix can be calculated using quantum computing.
He discusses the challenges in comparing quantum computers to classical computers.
topics: Comparison of Quantum and Classical Computers

sections.title: Section 2: Google Study Problem
content: The Google study problem involves finding random quantum circuits.
Wong explains the concept of a unitary matrix and how it relates to quantum circuits.
He discusses the two layers of randomness in quantum circuits and how they make classical combination hard.
Wong explains the importance of calculating the permanent of a matrix in quantum computing.

sections.title: Section 3: Permanent of Matrix Calculation
content: Wong demonstrates how the permanent of a matrix can be calculated using quantum computing.
He explains the difference between the permanent and determinant of a matrix.
Wong discusses the challenges in calculating the permanent of a matrix.
He highlights the importance of using quantum computing for this problem.

sections.title: Section 4: Comparison of Quantum and Classical Computers
content: Wong discusses the challenges in comparing quantum computers to classical computers.
He explains the importance of using statistics to build up models and make extrapolations.
Wong highlights the need for more statisticians to work in this field.
He discusses the limitations of current quantum computers and the potential for future advancements.
topics: Comparison of Quantum and Classical Computers

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion
content: Wong concludes his talk by emphasizing the potential of quantum computing in solving complex computational problems.
He highlights the importance of continued research and development in this field.
Wong discusses the need for interdisciplinary collaboration between computer scientists, statisticians, and other experts.
He encourages students and researchers to explore the possibilities of quantum computing.

topics: Comparison of Quantum and Classical Computers
